bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to George A. Kellogg, November 20, 1941

div1.p: Hutchison thanks Kellogg for the print of the Cornwell painting, which will be placed in the Lazear Building.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to George A. Kellogg, November 20, 1941
div1.opener:
C O P Y
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PA.
November 20, 1941.
Dear Mr. Kellogg:
div1.p:
The very beautiful print “Conquerors of Yellow
Fever” has been received. It came shortly after your letter.
It is a magnificent piece of work and we will have it hung in
the Lazear Building. I am writing Doctor Hench.

I would suggest that you send, if you care to
do so, and as you have so kindly offered, one more print. There
is a high school here in Washington which has specialized in the
history of Doctor Lazear. I have given them a framed picture of
Lazear as a boy and will have this print framed and given to them.

I want to thank you on behalf of Washington and
Jefferson College for the remarkable service which you are doing
in having this picture produced and making it available. We are
proud of what Lazear did and we are therefore correspondingly
grateful to you for this memorial to his achievements.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (sgd.) Ralph C. Hutchison Mr. George A. Kellogg
257 Cornelison Avenue
Jersey City, N. Jersey
